medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 was referred at age 21 in 1980 due to hypokalemia detected during a cardiac evaluation. Her condition included polyuria of 3-5 L/day and reduced urine concentrating ability. In 2012, at re-evaluation, persistent hypocalciuria and serum calcium levels in the upper normal range were noted, with hypokalemic alkalosis persisting. Patient 2 presented at age 15 in 2013 after a near collapse, with hypokalemia present since age 8. The patient's BP was normal but on the lower range.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 diagnosed with Bartter syndrome (BS) over 30 years ago, subsequently re-evaluated exhibiting features more in line with Gitelman syndrome (GS). Patient 2 had recurrent episodes of hypokalemia since age 8. No other relevant past medical history detailed.
medical_history.family_history: Family members screened showed serum potassium levels in the lower half of the reference interval; some showed occasional mild hypokalemia. Family history of hypokalemic alkalosis noted.
